Quoting  pallavi28183@...:

> Hi everybody,
>  
> As a part of my Masters, I am supposed to learn JUnit. I went through
> some of the basic papers as JUnit Test Infected, junit cook book etc.
> but am not understanding the correct use of that. 
>  
> Like if I create a simple program like addition of two integers and want
> to pass the values of a and b to be some (i.e., generating the test
> cases), how can I do using the JUnit.  I created a JUnit program
> "TestAddInt.java "with a testAdd() method in that compared the resultant
> value of a and b with the expected value but its something like I took
> the values a and b as ints..TestAddInt.java but am not understanding how
> to bring the values of the original java program "AddInt.java"??
>  
> I am pretty sure that if someone give a simple example, I will learn the
> rest. So I would be thankful if someone helps me out.
>  
> Regards,
> Pallavi
